Text:
Sound is as bad as the CD: http://www.dr.loudness-war.info/details.php?id=34853

Don't download, wait for the vinyl rip
^^^ yea, wait for someone, maybe, perhaps, to rip a vinyl copy and deprive yourself listening to new Bowie.  Yea, makes sense....

Here it is: http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/8297062/David_Bowie_-_The_Next_Day_%5B24_bit_FLAC%5D_vinyl

DR10 vs DR6 from the CD & this HD version (which uses the same master as the CD and is pointless because the songs were originally recorded at 24-bit/48kHz)

Vinyl DR10: http://www.dr.loudness-war.info/details.php?id=35893
I add: vinyl rips at 24/96 is pointless too in this particular case and for most listeners, but the important thing is DR (dynamic range) of the master used.
It's all about the source...... regardless of bit length or sampling rate.
